title: Tiring but worthwhile
review: The trek upto Patna waterfalls is not easy... its about 30 minutes but quite tiring. however, once you reach the falls, it is stunning... the water is cold, fresh and beautiful to soak in.

title: Worth climbing up, a shower from heaven.
review: Beautiful place, not too dirty,  not crowded,

title: Worth the climb to a beautiful falls
review: GO HERE! Yes, it will take you a while to get here and it is a steep ascent, but it is so worth it. Best way to get there, just start on the east side of the Ganga river and start walking north on the road. No need to pay a car to take you. The walk down this road to the falls is about an hour a and a half. Yes I know, kind of long, but it is fairly flat and in the shade. You get to walk along the river and see how totally beautiful it and the mountains are. When you get to the place where you start walking up the trail to the falls, there will be a few little stalls and a clear trail off to the right with a sign in Hindi. The trail is steep but goes along a creek. There are stairs at some points. Close to the place where the falls are there is a fork in the path. GO RIGHT! There is one final scramble and then you're there! After you have a great time, do the 1.5-hour walk back to town! Piece of cake!

title: Go to Patna Waterfall when you are idle at Rishikesh
review: A very brief trek. Go here with a very good friend or a lover. A group of 3 to 4 good friends is ideal. Don't loose way as this falls in the midst of a trek which ultimately leads to Patna Village where there is nothing apart from dense forest & a beautiful residential Yogapeeth. Go in the afternoon to enjoy tranquility. Trek is steep but not difficult at all. However, don't try to display heroism as you might fall. Enjoy yourself.

title: Pleasant walk in the forest
review: You climb fast on well defined tracks and encounter  these beautiful waterfalls where people bathe. The temperature was in the 30C but the water was very refresshing. You will find a cafe with table and chairs in the middle of the water and it is quite funny to see the waiter trying to get to the tables carrying precariuosly full trays of drinks. A lovely afternoon activities with some interesting wild life and flora.

title: Fall
review: this waterfall is very nice and peaceful movement for me i was really enjoyed and feel that movement

title: If you're in the area....
review: IF you go out the road to MohanChatti, do make plans to stop at these waterfalls.  Refreshing when the weather is hot!

title: Good
review: I like the place and it is situated at good place. Because most of the peoples are visited on this place every day.

title: The attraction are the donkeys!
review: The waterfall is beautiful but with reduced water volume. The trail is also part of the trail to the Patna Village (its only access), and because of that several groups of donkeys carrying all sorts of things to the village can be seen during the walk!

title: Good Place
review: I like this place too much. You can visit with friends and enjoy the waterfall with full masti. You must visit there and enjoy your time

title: Beautiful waterfall and small trek
review: This is one of the most beautiful waterfalls in Rishikesh and the trek to the waterfall is amazing. You will have good fun trekking, there are few steep spots before you reach this hidden jewel which is not anymore hidden now. Do go for it and u will surely enjoy it.

title: Masti Time
review: It is nice place to visit again and again with friends and family. You enjoy very much this place and do masti as you want . Superlike

title: Nice Water fall in Rishikesh
review: Patna Fall is must visit place if you're planning a trip to Badrinath/Jumpin Heights. Its hidden on the way to Badrinath Temple. We 12 people visited this Place during our Rafting Trip to Rishikesh in May 2018.

title: Patna fall
review: The most beautiful and incredible place I have been. As you will saw waterfall you will fall in love with it. And a small trekking on himalaya made it more interesting. We mostly take our yoga groups to waterfall. Everybody like that place a lot. We heartily recommend this place.

title: Good waterfall and trek
review: The trekking is good and the waterfall is beautiful. It forms a small pool, where one can swim and the stop at the top has some good food to offer.

title: Trek n waterfall
review: There is a trek of about an hour to reach this waterfall. Quite steep at some places and bit rocky. The best time to go is as early as possible in the morning to avoid crowd. There is a small Maggie point at the top which is actually very good. The waterfall in itself is not that amazing and ok kinds.

title: Bahubali style falls
review: An extremely picturesque place once you reach there, the hike is quite tiring especially in hot and humid weather but once you reach the falls you feel fresh, the water is cold and a bath is a must. There is tiny fish in the pool that gives you a free pedicure. Do carry a water bottle along. It's about a 40 minute hike.

title: waterfalls a good place for frnds
review: you can go over there only by walk,, it just 1.5 km from the road to upside. forest waterfall so only can go with friends not suitable for family purpose. but the waterfall is good, and enjoying moment over there.

title: Best Hiking in Monsoons
review: This is one amazing trekking destination near Mohanchatti on the outskirts of Rishikesh. The best time to visit is between July and August, during the rains. Very photogenic and mesmerising. A photographer's delight. Try long exposure shots here.

title: Magical
review: Less explored . Perfect for bunch of friends. Wouldn't recommend for family. There is a high chance that you'll be alone if you visit at the right time. You can get the entire place for.yourself.

title: Very relaxing waterfall
review: great day out in Rishikesh especially if you trek there and take a picnic. Very rewarding once you get to the top. There is a hut where you can buy some snacks too. Very relaxing waterfall.

title: A great walk and fantastic view
review: We made it all by feet from swarg ashram and it was a great walk. The road up to tge waterfall is not an easy one but worth it 100%. Beautiful, natural, clean, we were so happy we made it to this place. Had chai in tiny cafe nearby with a sweet and welcoming owner.

title: Cool hike
review: I recommend this hike especially during rainy times and I guess should be good even for Indian winters.

title: good waterfall but less water
review: we reached there in june and there was not much water running down. may be cause of summers but we enjoyed much. it is near to sward ashram. you can relax there

title: Super Adventure
review: Luvd the trekking experience here with my friends during my last adventure holiday in Rishikesh. Good for photography and bird watching too.

title: good views , clean place
review: the trek is little steep but the cold water is relaxing, good to spend couple of hours there. very clean as of now

title: Mystic water falls + Village + temple
review: 15min from Rishikesh. easy to find. 30 mins hike. No entry ticket.

title: Only one stream of water
review: Its a very unpopular fall.....has only one stream of water falling (Very less water).....its around 1,.5 km.s walk on slippery stony passage....this slippage is in winters so in rains it would be worse. not at all recommended especially if u have kids.

title: Just Stunning
review: Serene, peaceful, ancient are just a few words that come to mind. It is only a little hike to the falls but once you are there it is like you have stepped into another world. They are just beautiful. Even though it was winter we enjoyed walking through the cool water and sitting and just listening for quite awhile. Well worth the drive.

title: Great little waterfall, only 30 minutes from Rishikesh
review: A great little walk to this waterfall - along the much quieter road along the Ganga compared to the walk to the Neer Gath Waterfall.

title: love love love
review: The most amazing place to meditate, relax, enjoy the view, get refreshed and enjoy nature.. pure paradise.

title: Must Visit
review: Must Visit place in Rishikesh it's untouched by the commercialization & is very natural . Should be visited Early in the afternoon.The waterfall shines in the sunlight to give a very majestic look to the fall.There is a chai shop nearby where you can spend sometime & relax must go place with your family or friends .The trek is a little tough if you're not a regular Walker not too far from the road near phoolchatti. The route is pretty marked & you can easily see it once you are on the way.Take some bathing clothes with you so that you can fully enjoy the natural beauty.Ensure not to throw anything nearby or on the route.

title: Awesome
review: It is so awesome to be here.  this is an untouched place and very relaxing and awesome.   you forget everything when you reach here.

title: Do yourself a favour and visit!
review: One of mother nature's best natural architectural forms and the best I've seen so far. The walk in itself is great to unwind, pack water and suncream and you're good to go. Photos will never do it justice.

title: Nice n safe waterfall for 15-20 minutes enjoyement
review: Visited this with friends while stayed in rattapani resorts on neelkanth road,  rishikesh.  its around 1.5 kms from road and a good trekking spot.  pull ur socks and tighten ur shoe laces before walking to this place.  waterfall is around 150 feet high,  water falls in small stream when its not raining.  with friends its a nice place to have fun and play in cold water of fall.

title: Refreshing
review: After a great hike you get to this most inspiring and refreshing waterfall, please pick up littering along the way and stick in a bottle and drop of at the top :) Thanks Children of the Ganges

title: Mohan chatti visit
review: It is a lovely place for the visitors who are adventurous and who spend time in peace out the overcrowded towns.

title: Very good water fall
review: Wonderful place and natural places  it situated in Patna in bihar state

title: Average waterfall. Good hiking place!
review: Well, this hike takes around 20-30 mins to reach the waterfall. I would suggest you not to go to this waterfall during summer as there is not much water. Instead you can go to Garud Chatti waterfall. It is less crowded and water is also clear.

title: Not much water in summers, but refreshing!
review: We visited the place during summers and that is probably the reason why there was not much water running down. But the hike and the end-sight was worth the time and effort. It is uphill, around one kilometer and there are no defined paths, only a foot path. By the time we were at the waterfall, we were huffing & puffing but the minute we got under the water, all the tiredness vanished! The water is so refreshing!

title: Beauty overloaded..
review: One of the most beautiful waterfall I have ever seen....less crowded place make it more attractive..

title: Best Trek of my life
review: We went for this trek along with guides from Aranyam resort and totally loved the experience. The kids enjoyed the trekking and bird watching experience here.

title: superb trek
review: amazing trekking place in rishikesh. recommended for all adventure lovers. all of us enjoyed trekking here. thank you to our guide govind from aranyam river retreat. we enjoyed it.

title: Woooooow nice place
review: Woooow guyes nice place for all of you. It's special for couples and family it is nice place in Bihar

title: The most beautiful
review: This is the most beautiful waterfall I have ever seen. It looks like the trees are frozen. After a trek for around 15-20 minutes (form the road) this was perhaps the most beautiful surprise we had.

title: Nice place
review: Nice place good place awesome place good place for all, i think it's awesome, nice place good place for all.

title: Good and Scenic
review: We had been to neer Garh so this one did not rise upto the expectations. Yet its quite good and can be visited by travelers with ample time.

title: Little hard to reach
review: Small treck but very steep. I took lot of effort to reach there but after reaching there you can relax at least for 40-45 mins.

title: A Showering Stream
review: The waterfall is hidden up on a 40 degree hill. Mules walk the trail and the slow climb is rewarded with a 70 meter high waterfall. There is not much water in March, so if you need to bathe, walk towards the corner of the rocks where the bulk of the water falls. There's a small cave good for pictures and some grassy structures above it. It is a good hike and worth the effort if you are going to have water splashing fun with friends.

title: Waterfall patna
review: Its really a nice visit to patna waterfall..

title: Excellent Trek
review: While we have many waterfalls in MP, this waterfall is also a great trekking experience. Darshan ji (from Aranyam resort) thank you so much for taking us for trek here.

title: Enjoyed waterfall trek
review: Thank you Mr. Darshan from Aranyam River Retreat for getting us to this magical place for trekking. We truly enjoyed it.

title: Beautiful Trek
review: If you love trekking and are in Rishikesh, do not miss the opportunity to go for hiking here. Also some very nice photography opportunities. If you are lucky you may also spot some wildlife and birds.

title: Wonderful...!
review: We trekked up to this waterfall one morning. It's an easy enough trek and luckily there was no one besides us so we had the place entirely to ourselves. The waterfall is beautiful and the trek runs through shaded forest patches so is not too strenuous or tiring either. Must do!

title: enjoyable trek for the whole family
review: we all enjoyed trekking to this place including my wife and kids. a little steep climb but not very difficult for those who are used to walking. beautiful waterfall. must visit

title: Heavenly spray in lush greenery...
review: Loved the  trek to Patna waterfall, with streams trickling down amid lush green foliage. The waterfall itself has a lovely spray of water flowing down from a little high above.

title: Enjoyable Adventure
review: We enjoyed trekking here along with staff from our resort. Dont forget to carry your binoculars. We spotted many Hornbills here and some other exotic birds.

title: WOW
review: This is a wow place. We enjoyed trekking and picnic here.Good for adventure lovers. Very peaceful place and not a very tough trek.

title: A waterfall in heaven
review: This is small waterfall but the green and the beautiful spray of waterfall make a magic to this waterfall.  Go and experience the magic. Be careful when walk up and down as slippy road.

title: This is like visiting the garden of heaven
review: Awesome scenery a must in Rishikesh. Don't forget to put your bathing suit you have to experience the purity of the waterfall and the energy that comes from it. The hick to go there take 20 minutes fron the road and is kind of hilly but really worst it!

title: simply the best
review: you will love this place, an mindboggling joy ride. this place is a great escape for summer. as you can see in the pics the waterfall is amazing, the flow & trek are both nice.

title: Refreshing Water falls
review: This water fall is 3 km from Garud chatti , one has to climb 2 Km to see this water fall , very cool and clean water with pressure can have massage effect on your body. Enroute birds and plants give you full pleasure of trekking in jungle.

title: Nice refreshing locale
review: This waterfall, also called the Garud Chatti water falls is in the Neelkanth road, a few hundred metres after crossing the bridge on the left turn. Cars are parked on the main road where there are a few shacks keeping soft drinks and chips etc. Then from this point, there is a gentle climb for 15-20 mins to reach the waterfalls. The climb is not strenuous and kids can also do it. It's beautiful near the waterfalls and one can easily spend some time getting drenched and playing in the water. Water seems clean and is not very deep.

title: Small fall but at a nice location, Trek is a bit tedious yet enjoyable
review: The trek is at places quite steep and has the stream flowing next to it for a quick dip, the fall itself is a small one with not much water but the beauty is in its untouched state and the gentle drizzle of water instead of a huge fall. gives a very serene &look, a stall nearby gets you quick bites & tea, worth going, but not with small kids.

title: A Surprise
review: One has to trek 40 mins to reach here. I didn't carry my water bottle which got me dehydrated but as I reached there it was a paradise. It is even perfect for trekking as it is all in the mid of a forest. This is the most beautiful waterfall in Rishikesh.

title: Superb fun superb
review: v beautiful and natural view. Osam place for trekking. Main thing is that its free not like any other places. Delicious maggi.enjoyed a lot and its simple Awsworth

title: Surprising
review: We had an amazing, relaxing time at this fall, words cannot describe the beauty of this fall. I highly recommend a visit, when in Rishikesh.

title: Magical waterfall
review: Amazing scenery of the waterfall. Water falling over a cave with foliage overhanging on the rocks. Short walk up,the hill to the waterfall.

title: Amazing Water Fall
review: If you are going there to enjoy nature beauty, Then you must visit this water fall. Take extra clothes to enjoy more :) .

title: Enjoyed Trekking while stayed at Aranyam
review: The trekking guide from our resort aranyam took us for a trek here. An amazing moderate level trek and great surroundings.

title: You can't forget the fun of this place
review: IF you are planning  to go to Rishikesh then please add this place in your list to go around.

title: Though Trek ,Beautifull Water fall
review: This one one of a kind water fall. Hidden deep up in the forest with a difficult trek to get to it but  once you are there it's worth all the pain. The route to it is towards mohanchitti. The route is difficult and steep climb. You must wear good shoes,water proof recommended and should not be worried about getting them dirty. The water fall is about an hour of up hill climb from the road. Mesmerizing and enchanting is the words that come to my head when i first laid my eyes on this beauty of nature. Must go, well prepared. Sun does not come through the jungle but mosquitoes do.Carry mosquito repellent and wear comfortable footwear for the trek.

title: Hidden paradise !!!
review: Climb up that hill and I can assure you that you will be amazed to see this place !!! Very rare to find in a place like Rishikesh...Glad that we got an oppurtunity to visit it...would like to visit it again !

title: Hidden Beauty
review: This was a surprise for us... We walked 4km down the road from our camp and then climbed up that hill to witness this rare gem in Rishikesh... Its a must place to visit for anyone who is planning to visit Rishikesh in future

title: Amazing Waterfall
review: It is one of the best waterfall i have ever seen, Beautiful height and beautifully made by Almighty, Please have a look at my pics

title: Patna water fall
review: Patna waterfall was really refreshing as the water was clean . Otherwise I could not take a dip in Ganges .

title: Bigger One
review: Phool chatti waterfall Rishikesh is situated at Neelkanth road near about 3 kilometer from Garud Chatti waterfall. This small waterfall trekking in Rishikesh and path is slippery, so be careful at the time of trekking to waterfall here.

title: Amazing Location
review: On my way to Abhayaranya, a yoga ashram built by Rishikesh Yog Peeth, I visited this amazing place. It's one of the best places in Rishikesh where one can have a wonderful time just by doing nothing.

title: Great hike to a beautiful waterfall
review: Stopped by here with my group after having done some yoga and meditation on the rocks of the Ganga river.  The hike had a relatively steep incline but after about 30 minutes you reach the cool, refreshing waterfall.  Totally worth the hike.

title: Beautiful falls - Less-visited and must-visit place
review: Patna waterfalls is away from Rishikesh but not very far away. On the way to Neelkanth, after crossing Garud Chatti waterfall, one can find few tea shops. The small 2KM trek starts from here. The trek is very nice where one will cross the waterfall streams at 1 or 2 places. The rocks over which the water falls, are hollow ones with sharp edges. This make the water fall in the form of rain and this is the main beauty of the falls. It is a place not to be missed.

title: Trek to waterfalls
review: Its a small waterfall -- not as magnificent as locals made it out to be. Its a bit of trek, so wear comfortable shoes and clothes. I would go here only if I had spare time to kill.

title: Wow! Wow! Wow!
review: Owner of the guest house told us that there is great waterfall close to Patna village and that we should grab a taxi and go there to see it so we decided that we go by foot. You gotta walk around 5/6 km and you will see small waterfall on your right side and than you need to go into the woods and start to climb up for another 30min and when you come there you will see that it was worth it! Really, this was something which took our breath away. Drops od waterfall, sound of nature, smell of water and trees... breathtaking!

title: Confusion over name
review: I encountered much confusion in finding this place. I found out there is no actual waterfall named Patna Waterfall, but there are two waterfalls near Rishikesh.

title: Amazing Trek
review: This is a great place for a super trekking experience. If you love walking, photography, waterfalls and wild outdoors, do come for trekking here.

title: Patna Waterfall – Stunning Views
review: We family members planned a hiking trip to the Patna Falls in the month of March when the weather was ideal. It took us more than two hours to reach our destination and see the falls. There are three different points and the third and the highest point is the best waterfall. We cooked some food there and cleaned the place later to keep it well preserved.

title: Peaceful little location not possible to bath
review: Not easiest location to find, but the walk worth it because the nature is beautiful all along this walk and little hiking even ok with crocs shoes.

title: Must visit :)
review: Hello there.... wanted to share my experience about this waterfalls because it was a breathtaking experience.

title: Amazing Destination
review: Good place to have a hangout with friends under the water fall. The way to reach is some hectic but its a good destination to have fun.

title: A Very Nice Misty Waterfall
review: I love this water fall.  Really really nice and pretty.  Not a place deep enough to swim in though.  If you walk beyond the waterfall at the previous junction you will come across a great village too with really kind people.  One guy was having bees and honey and rented a single room out for next to nothing.  Really pretty water fall and also a lovely village beyond.

title: Patna meets at Rishikhesh..
review: Brilliant waterfall...must visit as the trek to this fall is also quite great and bit tiring but trust me the moment you see the waterfall...a word will surely comes out of your mouth which would be "WOW"..

title: its simply awesome!!!
review: if u are able to climb to this place u are treated to a natural beauty in its pristine. a must visit place

title: Surprising beauty
review: Our hotel proprietor recommended we visit this waterfall and we hired a taxi to take us there. It was a bit of a hike uphill to get there (maybe a kilometer or more) and we had no idea what to expect. When we made it to the top, were delighted by the sight of this gorgeous waterfall, which seems to flow out from everywhere up top in all directions. The effect is magical, like a shimmering curtain of water with light glinting off it in many places. There are also intriguing caves all around the base of this waterfall. It was truly worth the walk.

title: Beautiful hike...but a bit treacherous
review: Loved getting here, although there were times I thought i might not make it...as there were very steep areas and the ground is very gravelly and slippery. I had a walking stick and was often nervous, and I am a relatively young person.

title: Best Trek near Rishikesh
review: We were taken here by our trainer as a part of an exercise during our outbound training programme at Aranyam. Nice flora fauna and  peace all around.

title: Superb Picnic Spot
review: Went here after checking out from Aranyam on the manager's recommendation. Great trek and a very nice spot with natural wonders, birds and refreshing waterfall.

title: Hard to get but worth it
review: Without a formal sign, it was just luck that we got to the waterfall. The way up was beautiful but hard, climbing for about half an hour the steep and slippery way. But when we got to the waterfall and stood under it, it was just a wow. Worth the suffering of the way.

title: Neer Waterfall, Neelkanth
review: Very nice place for people who love hiking as well as waterfall. Perfect combination!! There are 2 ways to go one for hiking purpose also a short cut and other for bikes and cars. If you are with family then please do go with car as there is a lot to go after a car parking area. Also there is no public transportation.There are 3 points of waterfall. 1st one is good, 2nd one is okay and 3rd one is best but for the best one you have to go up around 500 meters high. I suggest you should stay there atleast for 3 hrs and I loved having maggi at parking and top point.

title: GREAT & BAD
review: A good walk to the top of the trek was a great view of the valley. The administration needs to put a few rules in place, like ban on taking alcohol to the top, placement of few dustbins all through the path. Place some benches en-route

title: Worth climbing up, a shower from heaven.
review: Beautiful place, not too dirty,  not crowded,

title: Tiring but worthwhile
review: The trek upto Patna waterfalls is not easy... its about 30 minutes but quite tiring. however, once you reach the falls, it is stunning... the water is cold, fresh and beautiful to soak in.

title: Worth the climb to a beautiful falls
review: GO HERE! Yes, it will take you a while to get here and it is a steep ascent, but it is so worth it. Best way to get there, just start on the east side of the Ganga river and start walking north on the road. No need to pay a car to take you. The walk down this road to the falls is about an hour a and a half. Yes I know, kind of long, but it is fairly flat and in the shade. You get to walk along the river and see how totally beautiful it and the mountains are. When you get to the place where you start walking up the trail to the falls, there will be a few little stalls and a clear trail off to the right with a sign in Hindi. The trail is steep but goes along a creek. There are stairs at some points. Close to the place where the falls are there is a fork in the path. GO RIGHT! There is one final scramble and then you're there! After you have a great time, do the 1.5-hour walk back to town! Piece of cake!

title: Go to Patna Waterfall when you are idle at Rishikesh
review: A very brief trek. Go here with a very good friend or a lover. A group of 3 to 4 good friends is ideal. Don't loose way as this falls in the midst of a trek which ultimately leads to Patna Village where there is nothing apart from dense forest & a beautiful residential Yogapeeth. Go in the afternoon to enjoy tranquility. Trek is steep but not difficult at all. However, don't try to display heroism as you might fall. Enjoy yourself.

title: Pleasant walk in the forest
review: You climb fast on well defined tracks and encounter  these beautiful waterfalls where people bathe. The temperature was in the 30C but the water was very refresshing. You will find a cafe with table and chairs in the middle of the water and it is quite funny to see the waiter trying to get to the tables carrying precariuosly full trays of drinks. A lovely afternoon activities with some interesting wild life and flora.

title: Fall
review: this waterfall is very nice and peaceful movement for me i was really enjoyed and feel that movement

title: If you're in the area....
review: IF you go out the road to MohanChatti, do make plans to stop at these waterfalls.  Refreshing when the weather is hot!

title: Good
review: I like the place and it is situated at good place. Because most of the peoples are visited on this place every day.

title: Good Place
review: I like this place too much. You can visit with friends and enjoy the waterfall with full masti. You must visit there and enjoy your time

title: Masti Time
review: It is nice place to visit again and again with friends and family. You enjoy very much this place and do masti as you want . Superlike
